parts.text: {"word":"acordarse","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"pronominal verb","definition":"(acordarse de) 思い出す、記憶している","english_definition":"to remember; to recall","examples":[{"sentence":"No me acuerdo de su nombre.","translation":"彼の名前を思い出せない。","sentence":"¿Te acuerdas de la película que vimos ayer?","translation":"昨日見た映画を覚えていますか？","sentence":"Siempre me acuerdo de mi primer viaje.","translation":"私はいつも初めての旅行を覚えています。"}],"collocations":["acordarse de algo (何かを思い出す)","acordarse de alguien (誰かを思い出す)","no acordarse (思い出せない)"],"synonyms":["recordar","memorizar","rememorar"],"antonyms":["olvidar","desacordarse"],"conjugation_notes":"This is a pronominal verb, so it requires the reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, os, se). The verb 'acordar' is stem-changing (o > ue) in the present tense and subjunctive, but 'acordarse' retains the stem change.","usage_notes":"'Acordarse' always requires the preposition 'de' when followed by a noun or pronoun. It is used to express remembering something or someone. It is often contrasted with 'recordar', which can be used without 'de' when followed by a noun."}],"etymology":{"value":"From Latin 'ad-' (to) + 'cor, cordis' (heart) + '-ar' (verb ending). Literally, 'to bring to the heart'.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/a.koɾˈðaɾ.se/","syllables":"a-cor-dar-se"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["me acuerdo","te acuerdas","se acuerda","nos acordamos","os acordáis","se acuerdan"],"past_simple":"me acordé","te acordaste","se acordó","nos acordamos","os acordasteis","se acordaron"],"imperative":["acuérdate (tú)","acordaos (vosotros)","acuérdese (usted)","acuérdense (ustedes)","acordémonos (nosotros)"]},"notes":"Reflexive verb. Stem-changing verb (o > ue) in present tense and subjunctive."}, "common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ Acordar su nombre.","correct":"✓ Acordarse de su nombre.","note":"'Acordarse' requires the preposition 'de' when used with a noun or pronoun. 'Recordar' can be used without 'de'."},{"incorrect":"✗ Yo acuerdo.","correct":"✓ Yo me acuerdo.","note":"'Acordarse' is a pronominal verb and requires the reflexive pronoun."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["acuerdo (agreement)","acordable (memorable)"],"related_verbs":["recordar (to remember)","olvidar (to forget)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B1","frequency_corpus":"High","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B1","text":"'Acordarse' is a reflexive verb that means 'to remember'. It's important to remember to use the reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, os, se) and the preposition 'de' when followed by a noun or pronoun. It is a commonly used verb in everyday Spanish."}, "example_sentences":[{"sentence":"¿Te acuerdas de nuestra primera cita?","translation":"Do you remember our first date?","type":"example","meaning_category":"remembering"},{"sentence":"No me acuerdo dónde dejé las llaves.","translation":"I don't remember where I left the keys.","type":"example","meaning_category":"forgetting"},{"sentence":"Se acuerda de todos los detalles del evento.","translation":"He remembers all the details of the event.","type":"example","meaning_category":"remembering details"}]}
